comment: The class was very inconsistent and unstructured. Many lectures were canceled and his communication with the class was shoddy. Despite this, he doesn't want you to fail. He'll work with the class and will never make changes that hurt you. His exams were easier than the material to account for the class' progress and he even had a retake for one.

Doesnt know how to teach, went from just reading off PowerPoint slides before first test, then switched to just working out problems with no theoretical explanations after a lot of the class performed horribly on test one. Tests are only 3 or 4 problems, and theres only two tests, so VERY little room for error.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: If you do not believe in Beadleism, you will not pass this class

Professor Beadles is not the guy to go to. He never shows up on time for his scheduled classes. He changes the syllabus for fun. He gave our class an exam 3 weeks early when 75% of the students failed or didnt understand the material. This man is not qualified to be teaching me Statics as he does not know the material himself. Dont take his class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: The class didnt do well on a practice test so in response he moved the actual test up 3 weeks. Not to mention he doesnt give us any additional help. Please do yourself a favor and pick any other professor.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Hands down the worst professor I have ever taken in my life. This man is no help, he does not teach, he does not care, cancels class, shows up late, changes the syllabus, randomly gives exams 3 weeks early. I advise for the love of your life not to take this horrible professor! If u do, good luck

He canceled more than a third of his scheduled classes. Sometimes he forgets. He can't answer questions students ask him in class. He gives timed graded quizzes over things he didn't teach. He is not a good lecturer what so ever. I have him for statics and he does not understand that material he teaches. This is 100% a teach yourself class.

spends the 1st 10mins of every class braggin about how great/smart he is. the rest of the class he jumps around from topic to topic without ever finishing explaining anything. Changes his mind or shifts policy directions alot. Makes promises he doesn't keep-Constant inconsistency. refuses to answer emails outside of class. doesnt do any technology

Sam Beadles was a decent professor, I've had worse online teachers. He did respond to e-mails however he didn't really record any lectures. You better do all the homework he assigns though because he will grade some of them randomly. I didn't like the exam format towards the end of the class but he did curve the final extremely hard. Works for me.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: This is the most inconsistent Ive ever seen out of a professor here at KSU, he never knows want he truly wants to do for tests and quizzes which leaves us in the dark, and he gets bothered when you ask him important questions about the class, this was the most stressful semester because of this man alone if you can avoid him Id advise you do
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Sam Beadles is by far the worst professor I have ever had. He violated FERPA by posting a file with every students name and grade in the class. He doesn't respond to email. He promises a lot that does not happen. He changes due dates on things to earlier due dates without telling you. STEER CLEAR OF THIS MAN! My A was not worth the pain of Beadles.

Terrible professor. Changed grade scales multiple times throughout semester. Communicates very poorly. Changed a sit-down final last minute to a 20+ page assignment that no students were given time to plan and account for. Please, for your own good, DO NOT TAKE SAM BEADLES.

Professor Beadles is probably the most inconsistent professor I have ever had. Promises and deals made with the class are broken, he is not good with any online, and class was cancelled or changed to online only. I think he makes Statics harder than it should be. If you need are not good at studying you need to stay away from this professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: This professor's grading criteria and scheduling was inconsistent the entire semester and kept going back on what he was going to do the semester. He made things stressful for his students which created confusion for many. If you have a choice to take him fully in person then go ahead but never take him if he's hybrid or online. You will struggle.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He did cancel a lot of classes that guy that said 10 out of 30 is correct. He did have retests if you did bad. Me personally I did not think the class was hard. If you practice problems that we go over in lecture you will do fine in this class. He is not the best at replying to emails. The homework is harder than the tests. There were 3 tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He canceled lectures quite a bit but he made his tests pretty easy to balance it out. His final was the easiest test of the semester. He gives make-up exams if you do bad. If you don't know physics, you gotta attend the lectures or self study, otherwise you'll do perfectly fine. Homework due once a week, every week. 1 quiz, 3 exams total

This Man canceled 10 out of 30 lectures we were supposed to have, and recorded an addition lecture we to watch over break to cover the last unit. He doesn't respond to email and didn't cover the last hw assignments till after they were due. The only other grades were 2 tests and the final, he does make up tests but cancels lectures to do so.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Things to know for Senior Project. You will be forced to buy a suit or not be allowed into class. Homework is reviewing a practice problems of a different section of the FE every week. The project itself very between semesters, I had to design a pump station but the semester before me designed a warehouse. Put in your fair share and make an "A"

I've compared my fluids notes with students who took other teachers, and Beadles definitely gives the clearest notes. But, he is a really harsh grader. NO curves whatsoever. And he be kind of harsh when responding to students. I really didn't like him, but I understand fluids well. My advice would be to take Kuemmerle if possible.

As the CCE department chair, his helps all seniors with developing their Senior Project and prepare for the FE exam. He gives as much or more than the students. Make sure you study for the FE on your own time. Make sure you have project team members who will work on their own to complete their work on time. Excellent class if you work hard.

Had him for statics. Great professor! I would recommend taking him for any course you can. He is very strict with his homework format, so do it exactly the same as his examples. Also, DO YOUR HOMEWORK! It is not mandatory, but if you try in the course and do homework, he will help you grade wise.
Awesome teacher! Take good notes and do all the homework. He is very laid back and will make you laugh occasionally.

Really good teacher. Thought i would hate the class, but beadles made the class. Learned alot,and i recommend taking. Come to class and do homework. understanding the material is key. listen,attend class and ask questions and you will get at-least a B.

Would definately recommend taking him for Fluids. He gets to the point and doesnt waste time. Tests are alot like the homework and examples in class, so make sure to do the homework and go to class and you should do fine.

He's definitely a teacher worth taking. He has a lot of funny stories to tell and they are a good way of taking a quick break from the material. Take really good notes most of his test comes from his notes. Any work you do for the class at home counts as homework for him, so turn those in.

He is a very reasonable teacher that explains the material in an understandable manner. Tests are very similar to the homework problems. His humor makes it easy to stay interested in class. If you go to class and take good notes as well as do the homework, it shouldn't be difficult to get at least a B.

Took him during the summer for statics. the class went by quick but it was very manageable. If you do ALL the HW he assigns you will pass with a B at least. If you don't understand, ask him right there. Really cool and funny guy too. And reasonable on his test.

Probably the most sane and polar techer in the CE department.  He is predictable at least and doesn't need meds. Nice guy and gets the material out.  Don't talk and use your phone in his class.....OR ANY CLASS!!!

Prof. Beadles is a good teacher, make topic easy to understand. You need to have an open mind to take his class, like to joke a lot, can not take it personal. Don't be late to his class or use your phone.
He is very hepfull, you need to have a sense of humor to be in his class. Do not used your phone
He is extremely helpful. Great teacher. Would definitly take him again.

Good teacher.  Knows the material very well, and has the English skills to clearly communicate the information you need to know for the tests as well as out in the field.  Honest straight shooter when you go ask for help.
HE IS SO SMOKING!!! YOU CAN GET BURNED BY GETTING TO CLOSE!!!

You have to have some what of a personality to be in his class. If you dont laugh, you wont pass. He is a great teacher who wants to help the students. Not to mention you can probably fry an egg on his chiseled chest! ow ow!
Really nice guy. Good sense of humor. You have to do a lot of homework but the class is not bad at all.
Prof. Beadles is a good a professor. He is willing to help when needed. He is fair on grading. Don't get caught with your cell phone.

Prof. Beadles knows the material extremely well and his lectures are excellent and directly apply to the material and exams. There's a lot of homework that's optional. Though it is collected and counts toward your exam grade +10 bonus. Grading of exams is harsh which is a trade off for a good professor that can actually teach you the material.
good and funny

I had him for Hydrology.  He is an ok teacher and a nice guy.  He needs to work on his teaching skills just a little.  He is picky about how he wants the homework turned in.  Just make sure you really understand the material in his notes.  His tests are actually kind of difficult.  We didn't use the book much at all.  He uses an overhead for notes.
Easy teacher, great sense of humor.

I took him for Fluids, he does know his material... but often he goes way too fast for anyone to finish copying the notes.  Some of the equations he gives us do not match up with the corresponding equations in the book.  He acts like a whiney women when it comes to homework.  He often writes random numbers in equations without specifing the meaning
Neat prof. funny in his own way. will make sure you know the subject.
Great professor...makes it very easy to understand.  Skips the BS and just covers what you really need to know
Nice Professor!!, Send a lot of HW but he takes the tests out of them. Try to go to class!!. Funny sometimes. I got in his classes "D" the "A". because of lassiness
He was a wonderful teacher...very helpful understanding and he really taught the material well!!! Take his class, but make sure you study hard and you will ace the tests.
Great Teacher
No Comments
Horrible teacher, we didn't get our first test back until after drop day and then going into our last test we only knew one grade.
He gave wrong answers to those problems. He teaches so little and He is not helpful at all.
It is a tough subject, but he taught it very well, very clear, and was very helpful.  do all the homework and you'll ace the tests.
This instructor is a hypocrite. He says one thing and does another. Lectures about being on time and he never is. He often gives you the wrong info in class to study then post the correct info later.
excelent teacher, it has been a long time since i learned so much in a single class.
No Comments
